name: Terra Lander
description: Navigate the player to the landing pad through twenty increasingly difficult levels within the time limit and with enough fuel.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP with all Service Packs or Better Processor: Intel 1.6Ghz core 2 duo or equivalent Memory: 2 GB RAM Graphics: 3D accelerated on board graphics, Intel  HD 4000 or equivalent. DirectX: Version 9.0

reviews.review_text: This title is amazing, It captures the old 8 bit game essence superbly. A great melody: On the Beautiful Blue Danube by Johan Strauss will accompany through the game, you can´t hate that one. Some will remember the 2001: A Space Odyssey movie when playing. The cynical narrator (presumably Stephen Hawking) will make you smile when you crash the Lunar Pod. The game has a good difficulty as you advance. 20 levels are the downside here.  For all of those who will play Terra Lander with a keyboard and mouse, I will give you an advice: when It comes to shoot, just shake a bit your mouse and press left mouse button. I was going crazy the first 10 minutes.  Good replay value If you´re one of those people who just want a simple but fun game to play for an hour tops.  A must have for Retro Gamers. 8/10

The video shows that you can use weapons, and I believe use of said weapons are required to get past the third stage, but nowhere, not in the controls or anywhere that I've seen, does it actually say how to use said weapons. I have tried everything from hitting every key on the keyboard to even clicking the mouse, and I haven't figured out how to use the weapons yet. I'm labeling this game as incomplete.
